snippet: A court sentenced Mam Sonando, 71, a radio journalist and land-rights campaigner, to 20 years in prison on Monday after convicting him of trying to incite a rebellion.
abstract: Cambodian court sentences radio journalist Mam Sonando to 20 years in prison after convicting him of trying to incite rebellion; human rights groups condemn the verdict.
lead_paragraph: A court sentenced Mam Sonando, 71, a radio journalist and land-rights campaigner, to 20 years in prison on Monday after convicting him of trying to incite a rebellion.
